txt.en: This scavenger hunt card has a list of things to find. They could be anywhere!
What sort of fellow was he? The Gaffer didn't know, but he wasn't a hobbit, tall and black-clad and stooped over.
Year 2 Tales: Sam

'Now these Elves aren't wanderers. They seem to belong here, more even than Hobbits in the Shire, and if there's any magic about, it's right down deep, where I can't lay my hands on it, in a manner of speaking.'
Defeat neekerbreekers in Midgewater Marsh ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'I've never told it rightly, myself, mind you. So if it's all the same, this is how old Mablung liked to recount it.'
DNT TBD Shake your fist at Gollum on the Anduin by Great River
Cards hang from the Party Tree. Each card contains a scavenger hunt to complete at your own pace.
You completed a scavenger hunt card!
<rgb=#FF00FF>Shake your fist</rgb> at Gollum by the Anduin near Thinglad
DNT LISTEN TO MABLUNG'S TALE OF THE SAM AND THE OLIPHAUNT
Sam's shears had long been silent as he listened at the window to that Gandalf and Master Frodo talking
Talk to Samwise on Cerin Amroth in Lothl√≥rien
Cook a stew with taters and a brace of coneys (three taters and two coneys)
'How sweet of you. You know just my favourite drink.'
Shake your fist in <rgb=#FF00FF>challenge</rgb> at Old Man Willow
Completed scavenger hunt card.
Eavesdrop at the window of Bag End
You cook up a tasty stew!
DNT sneaky sneaky bastard
We'd better be a bit more watchful, or we'll feel some nasty fingers round our necks one of these nights.
Visit Bill the Pony in Bree at the Prancing Pony
Fetch a small beer for Rosie Cotton
Completed

Every year in the spring, the Anniversary Scavenger Hunt takes place to celebrate a very special occasion.\n\n<rgb=#FF0000> NOTE: This quest will be removed from your quest log when the current festival ends. </rgb>
Pay your respects and <rgb=#FF00FF>bow</rgb> to Old Gaffer Gamgee
Recall with Sam in Rivendell the time he saw an Oliphaunt
Defeated neekerbreekers ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

You feed old Bill a carrot. He eyes you with doleful appreciation.\n\nTwelve silver pennies was at least three times his worth, perhaps, but he would earn far more in service before the journey was through.
If this tree don't let them go, I'll have it down, if I have to gnaw it!
